thread.title: Latest updates: Firefighters tackle huge blaze in Openshaw - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Latest updates: Firefighters tackle huge blaze in Openshaw - Manchester Evening News

author: Beth Abbit
title: Latest updates: Firefighters tackle huge blaze in Openshaw - Manchester Evening News

organizations.name: greater manchester fire and rescue service

text:
The blaze in Openshaw Share 
Firefighters have been tackling a large fire at an industrial unit in Openshaw throughout the night. 
Crews were called to the commercial building on Ferris Street just after midnight on Sunday. 
Almost ten hours later crews are still tackling the blaze, which is releasing large plumes of smoke into the air. 
Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Service said there is not believed to be any casualties. 
There are currently eight fire engines and two aerial units at the scene. 
Ferris Street has been closed off while officers deal with the incident. 
It is not yet know if there are any suspicious circumstances. 10:15 Video shows extent of smoke in area 
Manchester Fire service said: “We have firefighters on two high reach aerial appliances putting water on the fire from above and also in breathing apparatus on the ground. 
“The building is a commercial unit which caught fire about midnight - fire investigation officers are also on the scene but no cause yet.” 10:11 Keep windows and doors closed 
Residents are being warned to keep their windows and doors closed following a huge blaze in Openshaw. 
Crews are currently putting water into the building on Ferris Street from an aerial platform vehicle, and there is a lot of smoke being discharged. 
There are still ‘pockets smouldering’ which firefighters are targeting. Share
